odeProperty.value: School of Wizards. I became an amazing wizard! | Extraordinaries Ones Academy
Pieda Isabel Garrido Ruiz para Cedec

This OER will improve both English skills and ICT ones by using as a context the world of wizards. Students will develop the key competences and the specific competences. At the end of this project, they will have learnt to: •to debate and take decisions •to understand and produce oral and written messages •to interact and mediate orally and with written information •to explain information and remember details •to develop research skills and visual design skills •to learn vocabulary related to explorer trips (activities, material, landscape), to animals’ body parts, aromatic plants, ICT and free time activities •to express actions in the past with regular and irregular verbs •to express strong obligation and necessity •to read and follow instructions •to explain instructions to their classmates •to practice the pronunciation of must and mustn’t •to know famous castles and their location •to do descriptions using adjectives in comparative and superlative form •to know mythical creatures and to practice their pronunciation •to review pronouns (subject, object, adjective possessive and possessive) •to learn how to take care about animals •to express certainty, necessity, obligation and lack of obligation •to express probability or possibility and predictions

odeNavStructure.pageName: Schools of Wizards. I became an amazig wizard!

odeNavStructureProperty.value: Schools of Wizards. I became an amazig wizard!

odeComponent.htmlView:
"School of Wizards. I became an amazing wizard" is part of the "Extaordinaries ones Academy" projects. These projects can be done either following a pre-established order or without following it. However, we recommend you to do first Schools of Wizards: New at school! if you are in 5th or 6th grade of Primary to enjoy more the experience of studying in a School of Wizards.

Only the best students with a lot of imagination and creativity are selected to study in the School of Wizards.

You are going to develope the key competences and the specific competences (multilingualism and interculturality, oral and written comprehension, oral and written expression, oral and written interaction and  oral and written mediation) at the same time you practice basic knowledge such as  comparative and superlative adjectives, past simple, future with going to, modal verbs ('have to' and 'must') simple future (will), etc., and vocabulary related to  nature, adventure, pastime activities, technological supplies, cooking, magical animals and creatures.

You will have to do different tasks (individually, in pairs and in groups) to be able to do the final challenge.

The project is introduced to the students. 

At the end, they will get a certificate of participation and a recognition of their outstanding abilities.

The students:

  • Know  vocabulary related to explorer trips  (activities, material, landscape).
  • express actions in the past with regular and irregular verbs.
  • Learn to express strong obligation and necessity.
  • Read and follow instructions.
  • explain instructions to their classmates.
  • Practice the pronunciation of must and mustn’t.
  • know activities they could do if they attended an ordinary school.

1st mission: design a digital map  for a day trip including tips to guarantee safety when exploring the area.

The students:

  • know famous castles and their location.
  • do descriptions using adjectives in comparative and superlative form.
  •  know mythical creatures and practice the pronunciation.
  • review pronouns (subject, object, adjective possessive and possessive).
  • know vocabulary related to ICT.

2nd mission: they have to record a podcast to avoid parents concern talking about the school of wizards comparing it centuries ago and now.

The students:

  • know vocabulary related to activities to do  in their free time
  • debate, on the one hand, about having pets at home or not and, on the other hand, about buying or rescuing animals to have them as pets.
  • learn how to take care about animals
  • learn to express certainty, necessity, obligation and lack of obligation
  • learn or will review animals’ body parts

3rd mission,  in groups,  they have to design a digital poster about a magical animal describing it and with information to learn how to take care of it.

The students:

  • learn directions to make potions and to practice the pronunciation
  • express measurements when making a potion
  • make a cauldron with paper mache,
  • know vocabulary related to with aromatic plants
  • design a label for a potion
  • reflect about the 2030 Agenda  by creating a potion to grant a SDG
  • express future intentions and plan

4th mission: They have to make a potion in order to meet at least one SDG

The students:

  • learn to how to learn by playing Trivial

  • express probability or possibility, predictions

Final challenge: they have to design a digital scrapbook to help new students including ideas about things that maybe they will probably do.

The project is introduced to the students. 

At the end, they will get a certificate of participation and a recognition of their outstanding abilities.

The students:

  • Know  vocabulary related to explorer trips  (activities, material, landscape).
  • express actions in the past with regular and irregular verbs.
  • Learn to express strong obligation and necessity.
  • Read and follow instructions.
  • explain instructions to their classmates.
  • Practice the pronunciation of must and mustn’t.
  • know activities they could do if they attended an ordinary school.

1st mission: design a digital map  for a day trip including tips to guarantee safety when exploring the area.

The students:

  • know famous castles and their location.
  • do descriptions using adjectives in comparative and superlative form.
  •  know mythical creatures and practice the pronunciation.
  • review pronouns (subject, object, adjective possessive and possessive).
  • know vocabulary related to ICT.

2nd mission: they have to record a podcast to avoid parents concern talking about the school of wizards comparing it centuries ago and now.

The students:

  • know vocabulary related to activities to do  in their free time
  • debate, on the one hand, about having pets at home or not and, on the other hand, about buying or rescuing animals to have them as pets.
  • learn how to take care about animals
  • learn to express certainty, necessity, obligation and lack of obligation
  • learn or will review animals’ body parts

3rd mission,  in groups,  they have to design a digital poster about a magical animal describing it and with information to learn how to take care of it.

The students:

  • learn directions to make potions and to practice the pronunciation
  • express measurements when making a potion
  • make a cauldron with paper mache,
  • know vocabulary related to with aromatic plants
  • design a label for a potion
  • reflect about the 2030 Agenda  by creating a potion to grant a SDG
  • express future intentions and plan

4th mission: They have to make a potion in order to meet at least one SDG

The students:

  • learn to how to learn by playing Trivial

  • express probability or possibility, predictions

Final challenge: they have to design a digital scrapbook to help new students including ideas about things that maybe they will probably do.

odeNavStructure.pageName: Let's conjure up an excellent school year

odeNavStructureProperty.value: Let's conjure up an excellent school year

odeComponent.htmlView:
Welcome to the school of Wizards. Here, you will become an excellent wizard by developing your skills in English and ICT

The aim of this project is to promote the creativity of the students by attending The School of Wizards.  Therefore, it is essential to surf different websites and overcome several tasks that will help you gain knowledge and acquire strategies to be a Great Wizard.

You will have to do different missions along this project and finally you will have to do a big challenge.

It is easy if you do right all the previous missions. Are you ready?

When you finish all  your missions and your last challenge, you will get your Certificate of participation:

You can download the certificate in an editable file or a  pdf file

Along this project:

We are learning...

  • to debate and take decisions
  • to understand  and produce oral and written messages
  • to interact and mediate orally and with written information
  • to explain information
  • to remember details
  • to read awareness
  • to develop research skills and visual design skills
  • to solve  problems and to find solutions
  • to use ICT to  record a  podcast 
  • to use ICT to  create a digital map, a digital poster, a digital scrapbook and a label
  • to search for information on the Internet
  • to learn  vocabulary related to explorer trips  (activities, material, places), to animals’ body parts, aromatic plants,  ICT and  free time activities
  • to express actions in the past with regular and irregular verbs
  • to express strong obligation and necessity
  • to read and follow instructions
  • to explain instructions to their classmates
  • to practice the pronunciation of must and mustn’t
  • to know activities  and trips they could do if they attended an ordinary school
  • to know famous castles and their location
  • to do descriptions using adjectives in comparative and superlative form
  • to know mythical creatures and practice the pronunciation
  • to review pronouns (subject, object, adjective possessive and possessive)
  • to debate, on the one hand, about having pets at home or not and, on the other hand, about buying or rescuing animals to have them as pets.
  • to learn how to take care about animals
  • to express certainty, necessity, obligation and lack of obligation
  • to learn directions to make potions and to practice the pronunciation
  • to express measurements when making a potion
  • to make a cauldron with paper mache,
  • to reflect about the 2030 Agenda  by creating a potion to grant a SDG
  • to express future intentions and plans
  • to learn to how to learn by playing Trivial
  • to express probability or possibility and predictions

How?

By an Active Learning Methodology that makes you active in your learning process during classroom activities. These strategies promote a change of focus in the teaching-learning process. Therefore, we refer to it as a student-centred methodology. Active learning techniques include role-playing, group projects, think-pair-share, peer teaching, debates,  class discussion, etc.

Your teacher

Your teacher will act mainly as:

  • informant and resource, providing suitable input (dialogues, narratives, descriptions, word meanings, etc.);
  • assessor and monitor of meaningful learning experiences;
  • diagnoser of interests and needs;
  • motivator, prompter and generator of positive attitudes;
  • provider, organiser, controller and participant of second language acquisition situation

odePagStructure.blockName: Important information to take into account

odeComponent.htmlView:
The aim of this project is to create an infographic with relevant information for the new students of the School of Wizards as a final challenge to help other classmates. Therefore, it is essential to surf different websites and overcome several missions that will help you gain knowledge and acquire strategies.

In order to know important information, go to the following titles:

Your Work

Before doing the final challenge you will have to do 5 MISSIONS. The tasks that you will have done at the end of this project are:

  • 1st Mission: designing a digital map with information to guarantee safety.
  • 2nd Mission: recording a voice message to avoid parents' concerns.
  • 3rd Mission: creating a  digital poster as magical animal guide to show how to take care of them.
  • 4th Mission: making a potion to meet the 2030 Agenda.
  • The final challenge: creating an digital scrapbook with information to help other new students.

Assessment

Your teacher will use the assessment rubrics to evaluate your work on the missions and the final challenge:

  • Rubric to assess a digital map with information to guarantee safety (download an editable format  or download a pdf file).
  • Rubric to assess a podcast with voice message to avoid parents' concerns (download an editable format or download a pdf file).
  • Rubric to assess  a digital poster as guide to show how to take care of magical animals (download an editable format or download a pdf file).
  • Rubric to assess a potion to meet the 2030 Agenda (download an editable format or download a pdf file).
  • Rubric to assess a digital scrapbook with information to help other new students (download an editable format or download a pdf file).

Promoting your work

It is essential to promote the work you are doing  with your friends, family, town, etc. for them to know the school of Wizards

At the end of the project, if you do a great job, your teacher will give you a certificate of participation to outstand your abilities in the School of Wizards.

Learning Diary or Blog

A Learning diary will help you to develop your linguistic competence and  your autonomy in the learning process of English. Therefore, we encourage you to write your own reflections.  In order to do it, you will have to create your own  blog or  google site. Name it with your nickname and add the words SCHOOL OF WIZARDS (ex. IsaSCHOOL_of_WIZARDS)

Before publishing it, show your draft to the teacher.

Here you have the first statements to complete:

  • The tasks are /aren't related to my interests.
  • I can /can't compare the content with the previous knowledge I had,
  • I can /can't  apply the content in my daily life.

Student self-evaluation: work class progress

At the end of this Learning Situation, fill up a following handout  in order to know about your class work progress.

You can download the handout in an editable file or  a pdf file.

Tips to work cooperatively

Teamwork skills are essential for success in all areas of life: school, sports, etc. It is important to read the following tips to work cooperatively for you to do it greatly.

You can download the tips in an editable file or a pdf file.

Tools and Apps

To create, design and edit your work, you will be able to use the following apps, among others:

  1.  Canva, Genially and Google Site  will enable you to design and create your own digital map, digital poster, digital scrapbook
  2. Spreaker will enable you to record your podcast
